item.description:

item.title: World Network Sells $135M in WLD; Token Surges 14% Amid Identity Arms Race
item.description:
World Network has raised $135 million by selling WLD tokens at market prices to early supporters a16z and Bain Capital Crypto, expanding the circulating supply. The funding has backed a first U.S. rollout, USDC integration and partnerships such as Razer, as more users seek Orb-verified World IDs.

item.title: Hong Kong Passes Stablecoin Bill, Paving Way for Licensing Regime by Year-End
item.description:
Hong Kong has passed its Stablecoin Bill in a third reading, setting a detailed licensing path for fiat-backed tokens. By clarifying backing rules and interest treatment, the city has positioned itself as a regulated hub and invited banks and crypto firms to file with the HKMA before 2025.

The post Hong Kong Passes Stablecoin Bill, Paving Way for Licensing Regime by Year-End appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Feds Probed Hailey Welch After $400M ‘Hawk Tuah’ Meme Coin Imploded
item.description:
Hailey Welch has confirmed she was questioned by SEC and FBI agents after the HAWK meme-coin soared to a $400 m valuation then collapsed. Cleared of wrongdoing, the influencer has said she read pre-written promos, had no wallet control and now regrets steering followers into the failed token.

item.title: GENIUS Act Wins Industry Praise From Blockchain Association As Crypto Sector Awaits Final Vote
item.description:
The GENIUS Act has advanced after a 66-32 Senate cloture vote, showing bipartisan momentum for the first comprehensive US stablecoin framework. Backers say it would clarify rules and protect consumers; critics fear it could widen Donald Trump’s sway via USD1. A final vote is due after Memorial Day.

The post GENIUS Act Wins Industry Praise From Blockchain Association As Crypto Sector Awaits Final Vote appeared first on Cryptonews.
